security_audit.summary: Documentation-focused skill with one utility script for rendering GraphViz diagrams. All static findings are false positives caused by the scanner detecting markdown code formatting, legitimate documentation references, and substring matches in harmless words. No malicious intent, no network access, no credential exposure, no data exfiltration.

content.user_title: Create and test Claude Code skills with TDD
content.value_statement: Creating effective skills requires systematic testing and persuasion-based design. This skill teaches RED-GREEN-REFACTOR methodology for documentation, helping you build bulletproof skills that agents follow even under pressure.
actual_capabilities: Apply TDD cycle to skill creation with RED baseline testing, GREEN skill writing, and REFACTOR loophole closing
Design skills using persuasion principles (authority, commitment, scarcity) to ensure compliance under pressure
Write pressure scenarios with combined pressures (time, sunk cost, exhaustion) to test discipline-enforcing skills
Create GraphViz flowcharts for decision processes using render-graphs.js utility
Structure skill documentation with frontmatter, discovery optimization, and progressive disclosure patterns
limitations: Does not execute external code or access network resources
Does not provide built-in test runner for skill evaluations
Requires GraphViz installation for flowchart rendering
Focuses on Claude Code skill authoring, not general documentation practices

use_cases.title: Create new skills
use_cases.description: Build and test Claude Code skills using TDD methodology before deployment to production

use_cases.title: Bulletproof existing skills
use_cases.description: Identify and close loopholes in discipline-enforcing skills using rationalization tables and red flags

use_cases.title: Test skills under pressure
use_cases.description: Create realistic pressure scenarios to verify skills resist rationalization during agent execution

prompt_templates.title: Create skill baseline
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a realistic scenario WITHOUT any skill documentation, document exactly what choices the agent makes and their rationalizations verbatim. Capture every deviation from ideal behavior.

prompt_templates.title: Write minimal skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a skill that specifically addresses the baseline failures documented. Focus on closing loopholes with explicit counters, rationalization tables, and 'no exceptions' rules.

prompt_templates.title: Pressure test skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a pressure scenario combining 3+ pressures (time urgency, sunk cost, authority override, exhaustion). Run scenario WITH the skill. Document if agent complies or finds new rationalizations.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor for bulletproofing
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze agent rationalizations from pressure testing. Add explicit counters to skill: 'No exceptions' section, red flags list, rationalization table with 'Reality' column. Re-test until agent follows rules under maximum pressure.

output_examples.input: I need to create a new skill for test-driven development enforcement
output: RED phase: Run scenario without skill ‚Üí Agent skips tests, rationalizes with 'manual testing is faster'
GREEN phase: Write skill with 'YOU MUST' language, 'No exceptions' section, specific counters to 'already manually tested'
REFACTOR: Agent found new loophole 'following spirit not letter' ‚Üí Add 'Violating letter violates spirit' principle
Result: Agent follows TDD rule under 3+ combined pressures (time, cost, exhaustion)

output_examples.input: Help me improve my existing verification skill
output: Run pressure scenario with 3 combined pressures (time, sunk cost, authority)
Document new rationalizations agent uses to bypass verification steps
Add explicit counters: 'No exceptions' list, red flags for rationalization symptoms
Re-test until agent cannot find loopholes under maximum pressure

best_practices: Always run baseline scenarios WITHOUT the skill first to discover what agents naturally do before writing documentation
Use combined pressures (3+) in testing scenarios - single pressure tests are insufficient to reveal compliance gaps
Close every loophole explicitly with 'No exceptions' rules, rationalization tables, and red flags lists
anti_patterns: Writing skills before testing - reveals assumptions, not actual agent behavior under pressure
Testing only with single pressure scenarios - agents resist single pressures but break under multiple combined pressures
Adding generic counters like 'Do not cheat' - instead use specific negations like 'Do not keep code as reference'

faq.question: What is the minimum word count for an effective skill?
faq.answer: Getting-started workflows under 150 words. Frequently-loaded skills under 200 words. Other skills under 500 words. Concise tokens reduce context competition.

faq.question: How many pressures should I combine in a test scenario?
faq.answer: Combine 3+ pressures for effective discipline testing. Single pressure tests rarely reveal compliance gaps. Use time, sunk cost, authority, exhaustion, and economic pressure.

faq.question: Can I use this skill for non-Claude AI tools?
faq.answer: Yes. The TDD methodology, persuasion principles, and testing patterns apply to any AI agent system. Skill file format is Claude Code specific but concepts transfer.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using render-graphs.js?
faq.answer: Yes. The script only processes local GraphViz files and writes output to the skill directory. No network access, no data exfiltration, no credential exposure.

faq.question: What should I do if tests pass once but not on re-testing?
faq.answer: Continue the REFACTOR phase. Bulletproof skills require no new rationalizations across multiple test iterations. Add explicit counters for each new loophole found.

faq.question: How does this compare to Anthropic's official skill guide?
faq.answer: This skill complements Anthropic's best practices with TDD-specific methodology. Focuses on testing, persuasion design, and loophole closing. Official guide covers progressive disclosure and structure.
